Toggle Menu

salt.cloud.clouds.opennebula

OpenNebula Cloud Module

The OpenNebula cloud module is used to control access to an OpenNebula cloud.

Use of this module requires the xml_rpc, user and password parameter to be set. Set up the cloud configuration at /etc/salt/cloud.providers or /etc/salt/cloud.providers.d/opennebula.conf: 

my-opennebula-config:
  xml_rpc: http://localhost:2633/RPC2
  user: oneadmin
  password: JHGhgsayu32jsa
  provider: opennebula

avail_images

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.opennebula.avail_images(
								call=None
								)

Details

Return a list of the templates that are on the provider

avail_locations

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.opennebula.avail_locations(
								call=None
								)

Details

Return a dict of all available VM locations on the cloud provider with relevant data

avail_sizes

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.opennebula.avail_sizes(
								call=None
								)

Details

Because sizes are built into templates with OpenNebula, there will be no sizes to return here

create

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.opennebula.create(
								vm_
								)

Details

Create a single VM from a data dict

destroy

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.opennebula.destroy(
								name,
								call=None
								)

Details

Destroy a node. Will check termination protection and warn if enabled.

CLI Example:

salt-cloud --destroy mymachine

get_configured_provider

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.opennebula.get_configured_provider( )

Details

Return the first configured instance.

get_image

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.opennebula.get_image(
								vm_
								)

Details

Return the image object to use

get_location

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.opennebula.get_location(
								vm_
								)

Details

Return the VM's location

list_nodes

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.opennebula.list_nodes(
								call=None
								)

Details

Return a list of the VMs that are on the provider

list_nodes_full

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.opennebula.list_nodes_full(
								call=None
								)

Details

Return a list of the VMs that are on the provider

list_nodes_select

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.opennebula.list_nodes_select(
								call=None
								)

Details

Return a list of the VMs that are on the provider, with select fields

script

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.opennebula.script(
								vm_
								)

Details

Return the script deployment object

show_instance

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.opennebula.show_instance(
								name,
								call=None
								)

Details

Show the details from OpenNebula concerning a VM
